column1: San Nicolás de los Arroyos (usually shortened to San Nicolás) is a city in the province of Buenos Aires
column3: on the western shore of the Paraná River
column4: 61 km (38 mi) from Rosario. It has about 133
column5: 000 inhabitants (2010 census [INDEC]). It is the administrative seat of the partido of the same name. It is sometimes called Ciudad de María (City of Mary) due to a series of Marian apparitions that led to the erection of the Sanctuary in honor of Our Lady of the Rosary of San Nicolás that began during the 1980s and were approved by Bishop Cardelli of the diocese as "worthy of belief" in 2016.

column1: == History ==
San Nicolás de los Arroyos was founded on 14 April 1748 by Rafael de Aguiar
column2: who gave it its name to honour Saint Nicholas of Bari

column1: The closeness to the border between Buenos Aires and two other large provinces made the city a natural stage for the struggle between federalist and Unitarians forces in mid-19th century. The agreement between thirteen provinces on 31 May 1852
column2: which ratified the Federal Pact and called for a Constitutional Assembly sponsored by Justo José de Urquiza
column4: and became known as Acuerdo de San Nicolás de los Arroyos.

column1: Its main accesses are in the north-south axis: the Rosario-Buenos Aires Highway

column1: San Nicolás has an important port on the Paraná
column2: able to service large cargo ships. The railway system has passenger and cargo stations
column3: the latter reaching up to the port.

column1: == Education ==
The city has 43 kindergarten institutions
column3: 28 of High-school level (both public and private)
column4: 26 schools for adults and a large number of tertiary studies institutes.

column1: It is also home of the San Nicolás Regional Faculty
column2: a branch of the National Technological University (UTN)
